lines.text: [first lines]
So he says to me, I just soon they cut and stay off just north of Orlando. And let the bottom half go, right out into the Gulf. Say it didn't sound like such a bad idea...
Fair enough on the uh, Bakery Bridge, Chance. I want 92 for the Tupelo.
Ulee!
I could sell it myself... Fact is I've been thinking of doing just that.
Can you expect by next Thursday?
I can give you 39 barrels, I'll keep the rest...
You're not workin' as many bees these days, can you deliver?
I said 30. I'm ready.
Well - it's gonna be a good year. At least as long as they can keep the Chinese from dumping their honey.
The Chinese don't have anything like our Tupelo.
Ulee, most folks don't seem to care any more. The cheap honey floods the market.
The bees and I have an understanding. I take care of them, and they take care of me. We both just have to work a little harder, that's all.
You'll pay for the rest of your life for being a jackass.
Yeah, well, it's better than dying of boredom.
Me, I'm divorced twice. No kids, fortunately. I guess, fortunately.
We don't ask outsiders for help.

[explaining her drawing]
See, sometimes the bees get confused, and run away. That's them there on the tree. But they don't really want to be gone. And they're happy when someone helps them back into their home. But you got to keep calm and don't panic when they sting, 'cause they don't mean nothing by it.
You are almost a good man, Ulee Jackson, but you try too hard.
There's all kinds of weakness in the world, not all of it is evil. I forget that from time to time.
I'm sorry about this, Helen. I'm sorry about a whole lot of things.
Once you're better, I don't care what you do. But you're not moving until all that poison's out of your body. Even if only for a day.
Oh, man. You always think you know, don't you?
Well, I know better than to run from responsibility.
Is that right?
Right.
There's all kinds of running, Ulee. Your body might have stuck around, and that lousy bully part of your mind, but your heart took off a long time ago.
Oh, you can't say that. That's not true.
Maybe you're right. Maybe you never cared anything about anybody. Year after year, nothing touches Ulee!
No. No, it was you and Jimmy wanted too many shortcuts. I told Jimmy if he went down that road, I wouldn't lift a finger to help him. And you both managed major fuck-ups!
Ulee, come on.
I mean, who the hell are you, Mrs. Helen Jackson? A mother? Wife? No, you're nothing!
Come on.
And we don't need the whole damn world knowing what's going on in our house.

[chiding]
Watch out for water moccasins...
You add grand theft and assault with a deadly weapon, and that should be enough to put 'em away for a long while.
Let me know when they get out. They're not friendly.
[last lines]
What's so special about this Tupelo honey?
Well first, it's very uh, very rare...
